item.title: 【Helpdesk】[Tutorial] How to Decode MHM Files [EASY TUTORIAL]
item.description:
Hi!

I saw some people in this thread still be confused on how to use the code/aren't understanding the tutorial so I'm making an easier tutorial to help out anyone who's confused


[THIS IS FOR WINDOWS ONLY + I USE POWERSHELL, NOT COMMAND PROMPT + YOU CAN DECODE ANY 360 FILE WITH THIS {ex: m4a}]


Step 1: Create folder in Desktop (name it whatever or put it wherever you prefer, it won't affect anything)

Step 2: Download the .exe file from here

Step 3: Copy the .exe file into the new folder in Desktop

Step 4: Copy the .mhm file(s) into the folder (you can add as many as you want, it won't affect anything)

Step 5: Go to Desktop, 'Shift + Right Click' on the folder. Select 'Open PowerShell Window here'

Step 6: Paste this Command:


ia_mpeghd_testbench.exe -ifile:"FILENAME.mhm" -ofile:track1.wav


[DON'T FORGET TO REPLACE 'FILENAME' WITH THE NAME OF YOUR MHM FILE]


If it shows an error, use this command:

.\ia_mpeghd_testbench.exe -ifile:"FILENAME.mhm" -ofile:track1.wav


Step 7: Hit 'Enter' and it should decode it!


If you have any questions, feel free to reply and I'll do my best to help you. Happy Decoding!
item.author: bebesab
